alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 12:58AM CDT until March 25 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT FOR JACKSON...NORTHEASTERN MADISON AND EASTERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 1257 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sewanee to 6 miles north of Skyline to near Woodville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville, Scottsboro, Winchester, Bridgeport, Decherd, Stevenson, Cowan, Owens Cross Roads, Hollywood and Skyline. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Alabama...and Middle Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for damaging winds. These storms have a history of producing widespread damage across northern Alabama and southern middle Tennessee. People should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
